item.title: Midnight Oil founder and drummer Rob Hirst dies aged 70
item.description: Rob Hirst was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023.

item.title: Do Woolworths shoppers want Google AI adding items to buy? We'll soon find out
item.description: Without scrutiny, agent-led shopping risks quietly reconfiguring consumer behaviour in ways that are difficult to detect — and even harder to reverse.

item.title: Deborah Roberts not guilty after mass cattle death at Old Man Plains Research Station
item.description: Deborah Roberts has been cleared after being charged with animal cruelty and a failure to provide a minimum level of care.

item.title: Is there a 'normal' amount of sex couples should be having?
item.description: Whether it's TV shows or what our friends say, we pick up an idea of "normal" sex frequency from lots of places. But experts say how often you're having sex doesn't tell you much about whether it's satisfying or enjoyable.

item.title: Helen Manuell changed careers in her 50s from bridal design to sustainable fashion
item.description: Helen Manuell changed career paths in her 50s, swapping bridal couture for award-winning sustainable fashion.

item.title: Maggot-infested meal halts work at $1 billion hydro project
item.description: An investigation into a maggot-infested meal halts work on a key pumped hydro project in North Queensland, with more than 100 workers flown out.

item.title: Queensland health services report financial black hole of almost $1 billion as population booms and ages
item.description: The combined deficit of Queensland's health department and 16 hospital and health services in 2024-25 was the worst ever reported in the state.

item.title: Teacher loses bid to win job back after 'inappropriate behaviour' toward women
item.description: A disqualified Adelaide teacher fails to get his job back after a tribunal upholds a decision to terminate his employment over his "inappropriate behaviour" toward women.

item.title: WA environmental regulator recommends controversial Valhalla gas project go-ahead in Kimberley
item.description: Traditional owners and environmental groups are calling on the premier and environment minister to reject a controversial proposal to explore gas wells in the Kimberley.

item.title: WA government calls for unity on firearm reforms as Liberal-led states reject national gun buyback
item.description: The state government responsible for the Australia's toughest gun laws calls for unity on national reform, as the path forward splinters along party lines.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes lose captain Nathan Ellis and Test batsman Jake Weatherald for Big Bash knockout final
item.description: Hobart's quest for back-to-back Big Bash titles has copped two major blows with captain Nathan Ellis and Test player Jake Weatherald to miss the Hurricanes' knockout final against Melbourne Renegades.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Shooting by ICE agents in Minnesota incites national US protests
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Farmers Federation slams WA's heritage laws as 'a complete mess' and questions enforcement
item.description: A WA government department says it does not intend to prosecute media outlets for taking photographs of a protected Aboriginal site as part of their reporting on a breach of WA's controversial heritage laws.

item.title: 'Large bull camels weighing hundreds of kilos' move into NT communities
item.description: Hundreds of large bull camels descend on remote communities in Central Australia, causing damage to infrastructure in their search for water and prompting calls for federal assistance.

item.title: UK backs plan for China's new embassy in London at Royal Mint Court, despite spy fears
item.description: The new embassy will sit in the city's Royal Mint Court alongside London's famous financial hub, despite experts and human rights groups raising concerns about foreign interference.

item.title: Baby killer Lucy Letby to face no further criminal charges
item.description: The UK's Crown Prosecution Service says it considered the offences of murder or attempted murder in relation to the deaths of nine babies.

item.title: Marius Borg Hoiby, son of Norwegian Crown Princess Mette-Marit, charged with a serious drug offence
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby faces six new charges including an alleged "serious narcotics offence" in addition to sexual assault charges.

item.title: David Beckham breaks silence after son Brooklyn cuts ties
item.description: The soccer superstar tells broadcasters at the World Economic Forum that "children are allowed to make mistakes" in his first public comments since his son's allegations went public.

item.title: From small cuttings to large pots, household plants are being stolen in great numbers
item.description: Data shows more than 2,000 items were reported stolen from gardens over a year in one state alone. So what can plant owners do to protect their beloved greenery from theft?

item.title: Today in History, January 21: The first time the Williams sisters faced off in a Grand Slam
item.description: On this day in 1998, Venus and Serena Williams faced off for the first time at a Grand Slam tournament, starting an iconic sibling rivalry that would last two decades.

item.title: Home buyer says scheme does not work after setbacks buying old and building new
item.description: Erin Bell's efforts to both buy a house and build a new one through a government scheme were repeatedly challenged — once because she had disclosed a new boyfriend.

item.title: Jewish leaders call for vilification offence to be revisited as Coalition splits over watered-down hate laws
item.description: Labor's watered-down hate law reform has passed the Senate with the support of the Liberal Party but not the Nationals, who opposed the legislation due to freedom of speech concerns.

item.title: The trends and records to watch in triple j's 2025 Hottest 100
item.description: Here's what might go down when triple j unveils the Hottest 100 of 2025 this Saturday.

item.title: Victorian fires set to send premiums higher in areas where insurance already unaffordable for some
item.description: Neighbours living on the same fire-ravaged street in regional Victoria are facing vastly different recoveries due to insurance differences, and recent disasters may push premiums further out of reach.

item.title: Samoa's prime minister proposes ban on non-Christian faiths after vowing 'God-centred' leadership
item.description: Samoa's prime minister has thrown the future of its religious minorities into doubt after flagging potential restrictions on non-Christian faiths.

item.title: First Nations people will protest this January 26, a legacy dating back 88 years
item.description: Invasion Day rallies will go ahead on Monday after being exempted from NSW protest bans. Here's the story of how they started in the first place.

item.title: Scientific study documents Austrian cow using a tool
item.description: A pet cow in Austria has been filmed picking up a tool and scratching herself. An Australian hobby farmer says she is not that surprised.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Queensland teenagers create coding app to bridge digital divide
item.description: Young coding whizzes Neth Dharmasiri and Chinmay Lal believe learning the language behind computer software shouldn't depend on where you were born.

item.title: Insurance industry hoping to break a major barrier to expanding cultural burning
item.description: Insurance has been a major stumbling block to the scaling up of cultural burning, but a breakthrough could be on the way.

item.title: Donald Trump, the madman theory, and why even Australia is not safe
item.description: One year into Trump's second term, something has become clear: even those who leave the Oval Office with a deal, beware. It might not be worth the paper it's written on.

item.title: Mitchell Starc shoulder injury concerns Sydney Sixers after BBL qualifier loss to Perth Scorchers
item.description: The Sydney Sixers are thrust into a do-or-die final on Friday after losing to Perth, and star quick Mitch Starc is no guarantee to play.

item.title: Naomi Osaka brings fashion to RLA and Monfils says goodbye — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Naomi Osaka took to Rod Laver Arena in a white, flowy jellyfish fashion piece on day three as Gael Monfils waved goodbye to Melbourne Park. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Dane Sweeny's Australian Open first-round win over Gaël Monfils built on sacrifice
item.description: When Dane Sweeny triumphantly fell to the ground following his defeat of Gaël Monfils at the Australian Open, it was not just a celebration for himself.

item.title: Canegrowers celebrates 100 years of fighting for fairness
item.description: Australia's sugarcane industry looks back on a century of representation as peak body Canegrowers turns 100.

item.title: Parents of Piper James, found dead surrounded by dingoes on K'gari, shattered by loss
item.description: The body of Canadian Piper James was found on K'gari (Fraser Island) surrounded by a pack of dingoes after she told friends she was going for an early morning swim.

item.title: Perth Fringe World to feature over 3,000 performers across venues in Northbridge, CBD
item.description: This year's Perth Fringe World is about more than just racy burlesque shows, spicy cabaret and acrobatic performances.

item.title: Senior Nationals quit frontbench after defying shadow cabinet on hate speech laws
item.description: Senior Nationals Bridget McKenzie, Ross Cadell and Susan McDonald quit the shadow cabinet, after defying its position on the government's hate speech reforms in a late-night vote on Tuesday.

item.title: Nationals threat of mass resignation from shadow ministry a 'live option', Liberal source says — as it happened
item.description: A Liberal source has told the ABC that multiple Nationals resignations from the shadow ministry is a "live option" after three Nationals quit the shadow cabinet.

item.title: JD Vance and wife Usha Vance expecting fourth child due in July
item.description: The vice-president and the second lady have been married since 2014 and share two sons and a daughter.

item.title: The Pool Show at Penrith Regional Gallery casts a critical eye over Australia's pool culture
item.description: A new exhibition in Western Sydney interrogates Australia's enduring love affair with the pool.

item.title: Aurora australis seen across Australia as geomagnetic storms deliver spectacular light show
item.description: A severe geomagnetic storm has hit Earth, painting a colourful cosmic display in Australia's skies.

item.title: De Minaur overcomes early scare to progress to third round
item.description: Alex de Minaur is the first local to progress into the third round of the Australian Open after four other Australians have been knocked out today.

item.title: Chocolate manufacturers look to cocoa bean alternatives to tackle global market uncertainty
item.description: Cocoa substitutes are entering the chocolate market as the confectionery industry responds to volatile bean prices and supply.

item.description: Philippa Brant has resigned just months after the PM's top foreign policy adviser departed to run the Office of National Intelligence.

item.title: Trash and treasure trike proves powerful tool for brain health
item.description: Brian Slater, 77, is heeding advice to "use it or lose it" as he devotes his retirement to cognitive challenges that keep his mind healthy.

item.description: One of WA's largest meat processors is using AI technology to count thousands of head of cattle a day with pinpoint accuracy.

item.description: Naomi Osaka reveals a visit to Japan as a 13-year-old and the Williams sisters helped inspire the outfit she wore on Rod Laver Arena.

item.title: Victoria's bushfire-affected communities remain on edge ahead of another heatwave
item.description: Bushfire-affected communities remain on edge as forecasters warn of another heatwave, raising concerns about fire risk and extreme temperatures.

item.description: A wide range of cases challenging Donald Trump's actions have landed on the Supreme Court's docket in the past year. Here's what to know

item.title: Towns brace for potential 50-degree days as heatwave grips Pilbara and Gascoyne
item.description: Towns in WA's north-west could be about to experience Australia's hottest day on record, with the weather bureau expecting temperatures of 50 degrees Celsius in some areas.

item.title: NT pomelo growers fear imports from Vietnam will flood market, risk reintroducing citrus canker
item.description: The Top End's pomelo industry is worried about the impending importation of the citrus fruit from Vietnam. They say it will depress the local market and bring a biosecurity risk.

item.title: NT Police investigate fatal motorcycle crash on Stuart Highway north of Wycliffe Well
item.description: Northern Territory police say they are continuing their investigations into a fatal motorbike crash between Wycliffe Well and the Devils Marbles on the Stuart Highway yesterday.

item.title: Angus Crichton to leave Sydney Roosters and NRL to chase Wallabies World Cup dream
item.description: Star second-rower Angus Crichton will leave the Sydney Roosters at the end of the NRL season to pursue a career in rugby union.

item.title: What is skimo? All you need to know about the new Winter Olympics event ahead of Milano Cortina 2026 Games
item.description: Skimo is the newest sport at the Winter Olympics, but what is it? And who are the Aussies that will take on the challenge on the slopes of the infamous Stelvio climb?

item.title: Police find body of 18yo man wanted in connection with Kew stabbing
item.description: Police say a man wanted in connection with the stabbing of an 18-year-old woman in Kew has been found dead in the state's north-west.

item.title: Donald Trump's America-first policies are pushing countries into China's embrace
item.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

item.title: Crime gangs restocking shops 'up to 10 times a day' with illegal cigarettes and vapes, WA police say
item.description: WA's police commissioner says the restocking is happening faster than authorities can seize the products, as tobacco black market violence escalates.

item.title: American rider and brumby complete 4,400km journey across Australia
item.description: Gin Szagola and her brumby, Fable, have completed a coast-to-coast journey, covering 4,400 kilometres in eight months.

item.title: Alice Springs Mayor Asta Hill will not attend Australia Day ceremony
item.description: Asta Hill will not take part in celebrations of Australia Day, which she sees as a day causing harm to First Nations peoples — a decision described as "disgraceful" by the local member of the Northern Territory Legislative Assembly.

item.title: WA premier Roger Cook extends embattled Griffin Coal's lifeline, citing energy security concerns
item.description: Since 2022, the WA government has already tipped $300 million into propping up the insolvent Indian-owned miner, which is more than $1 billion in debt.

item.title: Canadian PM says smaller nations must 'band together' to stop larger countries overpowering them
item.description: Canadian PM Mark Carney told the World Economic Forum "middle powers must act together".

item.title: Chun Lai Yuen jailed after teenager Caitlyn Dickson seriously injured in Burswood crash
item.description: The driver of a speeding car which hit and seriously injured a teenage girl after a car club meet-up at the Burswood Casino precinct has been sent to prison.

item.title: NZ Prime Minister Christopher Luxon calls for election on November 7
item.description: NZ's Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has announced the election date for 2026, promising economic prosperity if New Zealanders vote for him again.

item.title: Liberals 'not that stressed' by leak — but Labor seizes on attempt to 'destabilise' leader
item.description: The leaking of an SA Liberal document two months before the state election has been described by the Labor government as a "calculated and methodical" attempt to "destabilise" new leader Ashton Hurn — but her party says it is "not that stressed" because the policy is old.

item.title: What we know about changing UK passport requirements effective February 25
item.description: Hundreds of confused UK and Irish dual citizens in Australia have written to the ABC with questions around the new changes for entry requirements into the UK. Here's what we know.

item.title: Tobias Lund Andresen upsets sprint favourites in crazy Tanunda finish to take Tour Down Under lead
item.description: Tobias Lund Andresen out-sprinted favourites Sam Welsford and Matthew Brennan to claim a stunning victory into Tanunda and take the overall lead in the Tour Down Under.

item.title: Australian NATO envoy Di Turton warns North Korea has 'combat-ready troops in our region'
item.description: Australia's outgoing military envoy to NATO is preparing to return to Canberra after two years in the role, and she is coming home with a warning.

item.title: NSW Police slap bans on neo-Nazis entering Sydney CBD on Australia Day
item.description: Up to 12 neo-Nazis have been issued public safety orders banning them from entering central Sydney, shutting down plans to attend anti-immigration rallies on Australia Day.

item.title: Man who assassinated Shinzo Abe sentenced to life in prison by Japanese court
item.description: Tetsuya Yamagami pleaded guilty to fatally shooting Mr Abe as he stood surrounded by security, media and supporters in 2022.

item.title: Why Elina Svitolina is prioritising her mental health at the Australian Open
item.description: In the highly competitive world of professional tennis, it is refreshing to learn that Elina Svitolina has her priorities in order.

item.title: New South Wales man charged with allegedly threatening prime minister
item.description: A NSW Mid North Coast man is granted bail after he allegedly threatened to shoot the prime minister, in a video uploaded to social media.

item.title: Midnight Oil's Rob Hirst died of pancreatic cancer. It's one of Australia's deadliest
item.description: Rob Hirst was first diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023. It is estimated to be the third most common cause of cancer death in Australia, and has among the lowest survival rates.

item.title: Have you been gifted an ancestry DNA test? The results could be 'life-altering'
item.description: If you're thinking of taking an ancestry DNA test as "a bit of fun", experts warn there is the risk of uncovering more than you bargained for.

item.title: Police probe possible link between Pilates studio fires and alleged arson attack
item.description: Police investigate fires at two NSW Central Coast Pilates studios, one of which was destroyed by fire less than a year ago.

item.title: Shane Marshall pleads not guilty to manslaughter charge over infant's death
item.description: An Adelaide man has been ordered to stand trial after pleading not guilty to a charge of manslaughter following the death of a seven-week-old baby who had allegedly been in his care. WARNING: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Police believe Mandurah teacher's baby fathered by student she allegedly sexually abused
item.description: Police believe a Mandurah teacher gave birth to a baby fathered by a student she allegedly sexually assaulted.

item.title: Zeynep Sönmez thrills Turkish fans with latest Australian Open win
item.description: In front of her loyal supporters, Türkiye's Zeynep Sönmez advances to the Australian Open third round, as her remarkable run continues at Melbourne Park.

item.title: New hate laws have passed parliament. What do they actually do?
item.description: The new laws grant powers for the government to list so-called hate groups, more easily deport or cancel the visas of individuals associated with hate groups and create new aggravated penalties for leaders who advocate violence.

item.title: Donald Trump's second presidency is about 'might makes right' and reshaping the world order be it in Venezuela or Greenland
item.description: As Donald Trump celebrates one year of his second term in the White House, he is rewriting all the rules for global order, and no-one seems ready to stop his "imperial ambitions".

item.title: WA gold companies 'floating on a sea of cash' as the commodity hits new price record
item.description: A Kalgoorlie miner hopes the soaring price of gold will incentivise investment into regional WA.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Banned Adelaide doctor Bill Tolis in court over steroid importation charges
item.description: A man who was banned from working as a doctor in 2022 appears in court charged with importing steroids and peptides that the Australian Border Force allegedly found in a medical clinic and at his home.

item.title: Plane landing aborted after alleged trespassing incident near runway at Melbourne Airport
item.description: A pilot is forced to abort a landing attempt at Melbourne Airport, and two take-offs are delayed after an alleged late-night trespassing incident.

item.title: Father of Adelaide girl who died due to mother's alleged neglect tells court of coffin threat
item.description: The father of a 15-year-old girl whose mother is accused of her manslaughter, tells the South Australian Supreme Court of a threat made against his daughter and punishment she was made to do.

item.title: Coalition on the brink as Nationals quit shadow ministry
item.description: Opposition leader Sussan Ley says the Nationals' mass resignation from her frontbench is "unnecessary" and has urged the rural party to remain in the Coalition.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners raise dingo management issues after teen's death
item.description: The body of Piper James, 19, was found surrounded by dingoes on a beach on the island's eastern coast, but how she died may not be known for some time.

item.title: Donald Trump drops Greenland tariffs threat as he heralds 'future deal' with NATO
item.description: Donald Trump says he has agreed to a "framework of a future deal" on Greenland after talks with NATO's secretary-general, and he will no longer impose tariffs on European nations that had opposed a US takeover.

item.title: Japan restarts nuclear power plant almost 15 years since Fukushima disaster
item.description: The world's biggest nuclear power plant has been rebooted by the same company that operated the Fukushima facility, despite concerns about safety from some locals.

item.title: Emotional Prince Harry says media made his wife Meghan Markle's life 'an absolute misery' at Daily Mail trial
item.description: An emotional Prince Harry held back tears as he described the impact of media coverage on his wife Meghan Markle.

item.title: Why Ukrainians are shivering through their fourth winter in wartime
item.description: The war-ravaged country has been plunged into an energy crisis as temperatures plummet below freezing, leaving millions unable to heat their homes.

item.title: Royal Hobart Hospital medical scan backlog creating late diagnosis risk, AMA says
item.description: The Royal Hobart Hospital is facing a significant backlog of medical scans, with at least one patient experiencing a late diagnosis. The AMA and a union say it's a sign of a system facing a range of pressures.

item.title: How closely have you been following the 2026 awards season?
item.description: Fancy yourself an awards season whiz? Test your knowledge as we rocket towards the 2026 Academy awards.

item.title: Republicans push to hold Clintons in contempt of Congress over Epstein probe
item.description: The Clintons are refusing to testify before a committee in the US House of Representatives, accusing Republicans of leading a weaponised process against them.

item.title: Sydney rabbi shares rituals behind how Jews grieve and heal, amid National Day of Mourning for Bondi victims
item.description: Amid the National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, Rabbi Jacqueline Ninio shares what mourning looks like in Jewish culture, from the resonance of stones at gravesites to the 30-day period of grieving.

item.title: Calls to bring back hard-hitting anti-smoking campaigns to warn off gen Z
item.description: Experts say Australia risks becoming complacent in the war against tobacco, with big companies pivoting to social media to "greenwash" their products to generation Z.

item.title: Some Adelaide University students unable to enrol in courses since merger
item.description: The Adelaide University merger has been labelled a "shambles" by some students who say they have been unable to enrol in courses or receive timely communication from the new university.

item.title: Nationals' walkout leaves Coalition in tatters
item.description: The departure of every single member of the Nationals from the frontbench is bizarrely both a failure of the Coalition agreement and a result of it functioning as intended.

item.title: Australia earns global praise for economic 'soft landing' but still dependent on China
item.description: A new report from the OECD says Australia's economy is returning to normal but remains vulnerable and lacks dynamism.

item.title: Europe holds the trump card as the US faces a mountain of debt
item.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

item.title: 'Ten-pound Pom' vows to boycott UK over 'money grab' passport changes
item.description: People who came to Australia as children from the UK as part of an organised migration scheme say they the UK's new regulations for dual citizens unfairly targets them.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes beat Melbourne Stars in rainy thriller to keep BBL title defence alive
item.description: The Hobart Hurricanes hold their nerve to beat the Melbourne Stars in a rain-shortened Big Bash elimination final.

item.title: Sinner weighs up Kyrgios and Kim Jong-Un, plus an Aussie exodus — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Jannik Sinner was stuck in an awkward moment discussing Nick Kyrgios and Kim Jong Un while Coco Gauff shared her top artists. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Taskforce set up to address ongoing power outages across SA from dust pollution
item.description: Ongoing dry conditions across South Australia since 2024 are causing dust and salt to build up across inland and coastal power networks, polluting insulators and leading to mass blackouts.

item.title: ASX rises after strong employment, Airwallex investigated by anti-money laundering regulator — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market has finished the day higher as bets of a February rate hike rise on stronger-than-expected employment in December. Look back on how the trading day unfolded.

item.title: Police Association says Coober Pedy and APY Lands are 'unacceptably compromised' by police shortage
item.description: South Australia's police union says some officers in the remote town are working 18-hour days and have been unable to respond to all incidents, amid an ongoing industrial dispute with SA Police.

item.title: Back-to-school budgeting a chance for kids to learn financial literacy and empathy
item.description: Managing back-to-school costs, especially when kids want expensive brand name items, can cause a lot of stress for families. But including children in the budgeting and decision-making process is key to helping everyone get on the same page.

item.title: Manchester City players reimburse travelling fans after shock Champions League loss to Bodo/Glimt
item.description: Manchester City players combine to pay back the cost of match tickets to fans who travelled to freezing Norway for a shock Champions League defeat to Bodø/Glimt.

item.title: Former and current presenters share 50 years of memories at ABC Classic
item.description: From late-life love stories to musical discoveries, presenters reveal what has made ABC Classic special for audiences for 50 years.

item.title: More than one disaster a week raises concerns over mental health support
item.description: Mental health experts warn of significant barriers to support in disaster-affected communities, as Australia records more than one natural disaster a week since January 2025.

item.title: $10 billion data centre planned for Hazelwood in Victoria's Latrobe Valley
item.description: Victoria's east is set to become home to a $10 billion data centre that will support the technology necessary for artificial intelligence systems.

item.title: Police arrest 15-year-old boy over alleged antisemitism incident in St Kilda
item.description: Detectives investigating an alleged antisemitism incident in St Kilda this week have arrested a 15-year-old boy.

item.description: Residents and experts say they are shocked and concerned after social media images showed a number of endangered and protected marine animals impaled and severed on a stretch of WA coastline in just a few weeks.

item.title: Plan to rebuild world's largest living coral aquarium explained after years of delays
item.description: The world's largest living coral reef exhibit is yet to be rebuilt five years after the Queensland aquarium closed.

item.title: Tour website's AI sends visitors to Tasmanian sites that do not exist
item.description: Weldborough in remote north-east Tasmania has lots of natural beauty. But it does not have hot springs — and it is causing headaches for locals.

item.description: Former NBL player AJ Ogilvy publicly reveals he is gay in a one-on-one conversation with fellow basketball trailblazer Isaac Humphries.

item.title: Why did Queensland's flood warning gauges fail when they were needed most?
item.description: Queensland's flood emergency exposed vast holes in the patchwork of river gauges relied on for early warnings. But getting them back online will take a lot more than a reboot.

item.title: Coalition splits for second time since election after Nationals quit shadow cabinet
item.description: David Littleproud says the Nationals have been put in an "untenable" position and are not willing to serve in a shadow ministry led by Sussan Ley.

item.description: There is no love lost between Naomi Osaka and Sorana Cirstea after the Japanese star prevails in a hard-fought three-setter.

item.description: A group of passionate locals have called for a long-term solution to the disappearing sand from beaches in Sydney's Sutherland Shire.

item.description: Can breeding birds and growing rice combine to help both conservation and agriculture in the basin?

item.description: It says a lot about the presence of youth in professional tennis that Alex de Minaur and Frances Tiafoe can already be considered veterans on the tour.

item.title: Unemployment rate drops to 4.1 per cent ahead of RBA's next rates meeting
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate fell from 4.3 to 4.1 per cent in December, according to seasonally adjusted figures from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.description: Several people are missing after a landslide at a campsite in the tourism hotspot of Mount Maunganui, south-east of Auckland.

item.description: March for Australia organisers are planning a fresh round of mass demonstrations across the country on January 26, with members encouraging others to join the now disbanded White Australia Party.

item.description: Sepehr Saryazdi has been accused of planning to use Molotov cocktails and lead a "riot" at the Gold Coast on Australia Day.

item.description: Littleproud and his team have now basically broken one of the most fundamental political rules of the Coalition — the Nationals are now effectively dictating to the Liberals who their leader should be.

item.title: In Davos, European leaders met Donald Trump with strength and he backed down
item.description: European leaders will be breathing a sigh of relief that the extraordinary threat of a US invasion of Greenland has receded. But some things cannot be undone.

item.title: More than 1,000 cane toads captured in first Darwin botanic gardens bust in years
item.description: Volunteers in Darwin have chipped in to capture more than 1,000 cane toads at one of the city's main attractions.

item.title: Australian writer Murray Hunter apologises to Malaysian regulator over criminal complaint in Thailand
item.description: Rights groups slam Thai authorities' detention and legal proceedings against Australian writer Murray Hunter, after Malaysia's communications regulator submitted a criminal defamation complaint.

item.title: What we know about the landslide at Mount Maunganui in New Zealand
item.description: A young girl is among those missing after a landslide hit a popular campsite south-east of Auckland.

item.title: Darwin locals volunteer at local cane toad bust
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Helicopter used to recover cars swept out to sea by floods along Great Ocean Road
item.description: Emergency services have conducted a dramatic salvage operation to recover more than a dozen vehicles from shoreline along Victoria's famous Great Ocean Road.

item.title: What's next, as Liberals and Nationals go their own way?
item.description: In the wake of the Coalition's divorce, there are few options for besieged Opposition Leader Sussan Ley, who must again reshuffle her cabinet and return to parliament with a diminished Opposition.

item.title: The 'Golden Dome' and why Trump wants the defence system in Greenland
item.description: Donald Trump wants a US "Golden Dome" missile defence system to be built in Greenland. This is what it involves and why some experts are skeptical of the plan.

item.title: Rockhampton escapes moderate flood level with revised river height predictions
item.description: Rockhampton was bracing for a moderate flood all week, with revised predictions now showing it will only reach a minor level. Some residents and sporting clubs will wait for days for waters to recede, to assess damage.

item.title: Jay Vine climbs into Tour Down Under ochre jersey after UAE Team Emirates XRG underlines its dominance
item.description: Australian Jay Vine claims the overall race lead at the Tour Down Under after an awesome display of dominance on the Corkscrew climb.

item.title: Woman who assaulted psychiatrist and other healthcare workers remanded
item.description: A judge tells a Victorian court the safety of healthcare workers must be protected while remanding a mentally ill woman to jail.

item.title: Anthony Albanese apologises for being unable to protect the victims of the Bondi attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese apologises for not being able to protect the victims of the Bondi attack, in an address to the national day of mourning memorial.

item.title: Friends pay tribute to Canadian Piper James after her death at K'gari beach
item.description: Friends of 19-year-old Canadian woman Piper James pay tribute to a woman who loved adventure and nature.

item.title: Perth financial advisor Anthony Paul Torre jailed for taking more than $1 million from clients
item.description: Victims of a Perth financial adviser jailed for misappropriating more than a million dollars from investors say his six-year jail term is not enough.

item.title: Temperature could reach 48 degrees in northern Victoria as state set to swelter through heatwave
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says maximum temperature records could tumble in some areas early next week — with the town of Ouyen tipped to reach 48 degrees — with heatwave conditions set to send temperatures soaring.

item.title: Forbes man Lawrence Wilfred Norris intends to plead not guilty to historical child sex offences
item.description: A NSW court hears the former vice-president of a local show society intends to plead not guilty to dozens of historical child sexual assault charges if he is found fit to stand trial.

item.title: National Party's Coalition split timing deemed 'unbelievable' on National Day of Mourning for Bondi
item.description: The second messy break-up between the National and Liberal parties is concerning regional voters across the country, even in diehard conservative heartlands.

item.title: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner asks Tony Burke for visa reform after inquest into Jerwin Royupa's death
item.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner has written to Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke asking for reform on the 407 training visa, following the inquest into the death of Jerwin Royupa.

item.title: Hot air mass travels across the country
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Geraldton man found floating off coast after WA police discover empty boat
item.description: Geraldton police find 61-year-old Kenneth Robinson in the water near Chapman Bay after they discovered his boat unoccupied this morning.

item.title: Severe heatwave to affect eastern Australia
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Two women and man killed in shooting in NSW town, gunman at large
item.description: Three people have been shot dead in the Central West town of Lake Cargelligo, with the gunman still at large.

item.title: St Vincent's Hospital charged over 2024 death of Makalie Watts-Owen
item.description: Makalie Watts-Owen died by suicide while admitted to St Vincent's Hospital's mental health unit, a month before her 24th birthday.

item.title: Bruce Reynolds being interviewed by Gary Adshead in 2025.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: City of Perth probe lays bare workplace 'crisis', erosion of trust between Mayor and CEO
item.description: The City of Perth has rapidly descended into a workplace of psychological harm, according to a secret report obtained by the ABC.

item.title: From Bone Temple to Oscar hopefuls, here are January's best movies
item.description: Multiple Oscar hopefuls are finally hitting Australian shores this month, as well as the return of zombie franchise 28 Years Later.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: NT auditor-general calls for more independence and powers following damning report
item.description: A new report has exposed a lack of scrutiny over how Commonwealth money is spent in the Northern Territory.

item.title: In pictures: The National Day of Mourning
item.description: Australians came together to honour the victims and survivors of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack.

item.title: First LNG cargo from Santos Barossa gas project bound from Darwin to Japan
item.description: After a series of delays, Santos announces the first gas from its $5.6 billion Barossa project will be shipped from Darwin bound for Japan.

item.title: Mackay council gives evicted rough sleepers 24 hours to move on from riverfront
item.description: Mackay Regional Council tells rough sleepers evicted from riverfront camps to pack up and move within 24 hours.

item.title: Emergency services under pressure amid string of bushfires across WA's Great Southern, South West
item.description: Hundreds of firefighters have been deployed to battle blazes threatening areas in southern WA.

item.title: Maddison Inglis wins epic Australian Open second-round match
item.description: With a 10-point tiebreaker to decide her Australian Open fate, Maddison Inglis knew there was only one avenue to victory.

item.title: Nationals senator Matt Canavan questions if government and agencies can be trusted on hate speech laws and attacks Sussan Ley
item.description: Nationals senator Matt Canavan has questioned why anyone should trust any government when it comes to the powers over hate speech laws, and unloaded on Sussan Ley's leadership.

item.title: Albanese apologies for Bondi Beach terror deaths
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Naomi Osaka apologises for 'disrespectful' post-match comments aimed at Sorana Cirstea after tense Australian Open exchange
item.description: Naomi Osaka walks back her aggressive retort to a tense handshake between her and second-round opponent Sorana Cirstea.

item.title: Oscars 2026: Sinners break record with nominations, Jacob Elordi and Rose Byrne receive nods
item.description: Vampire film Sinners broke the Academy Award record for nominations with 16, while Rose Byrne was recognised for If I had Legs I'd Kick You and Jacob Elordi got a nod for his role in Frankenstein.

item.title: Pakistan shopping centre fire in Karachi kills at least 55 people as recovery efforts continue
item.description: Investigators are continuing to search for others who died in the disaster, with authorities yet to announce what caused the blaze.

item.title: Climate change increased the chance of intense Australian heatwave fivefold, study finds
item.description: A study by World Weather Attribution has analysed temperatures during the intense early January heatwave. It found that what was once a rare event is now happening far more often.

item.title: France seizes suspected Russian 'shadow fleet' oil tanker in Mediterranean
item.description: The move is the latest by Western allies to crack down on a so-called "shadow fleet" of tankers suspected of carrying Russian oil against international sanctions.

item.title: Zelenskyy flags trilateral Ukraine, Russia and US talks, while slamming 'lost' Europe
item.description: The Kremlin is yet to comment on the Ukrainian president's announcement, made at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

item.title: Death toll from Spanish high-speed train disaster rises to 45
item.description: Train drivers in the country are striking after a string of rail accidents in less than a week.

item.title: Queenscliff Coast Guard rescues double in 10 years as boaters take greater risks
item.description: The Queenscliff Coast Guard has a long history of keeping the water safe, but the number of boaters taking bigger risks have seen the number of rescues soar in the past decade.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A political break-up, a fashionable entrance and Macron's aviators
item.description: Another week, another quiz. Are you ready to test yourself?

item.title: Questioning your relationship in the new year? You're not alone
item.description: The fresh start of a new year causes us to reassess many parts of our lives, including relationships. Knowing whether it's time to call it quits or give things more time requires reflection — and support — as our experts explain.

item.title: The Nationals split shows the foundations of right-wing politics are shifting
item.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

item.title: Trump touts 'total access' Greenland deal as NATO asks allies to step up
item.description: The leaders of both Denmark and Greenland say they are not aware of what is in the deal, announced by the US president earlier this week.

item.title: Australia names second-largest Winter Olympic team in history for 2026 Milan-Cortina Games
item.description: From five teenagers making their Winter Olympics debut to five-time Olympian and gold medal hopeful Scott James, Australia has named its second-largest team in history for the Milan-Cortina Games.

item.title: Anger and confusion after Australian courier Sendle collapses
item.description: The Australian company's customers feel like they have been "ghosted", while investors and shareholders are angry and confused about what happens next.

item.title: Venezuela's El Helicoide was built as a world-leading retail hub. Then it became a notorious 'torture prison'
item.description: Nestled among shanty homes, mountains and forestry, a giant building once touted to become Venezuela's world-leading retail mecca later turned into a centre for alleged human rights abuses.

item.title: Seven-day heatwave to engulf south-east states, raising bushfire danger
item.description: South-east states are predicted to bake through a prolonged severe heatwave from Saturday onwards, which has the potential to break all-time temperature records and fuel another round of dangerous bushfires.

item.title: Fiji police allegedly seize $780m cocaine shipment in drug operation targeting Pacific Ocean 'narco sub'
item.description: Fijian chiefs reported suspicious activity along their stretch of coastline to law enforcement agencies — which then swooped on an alleged $780 million drug operation.

item.title: Police fire at 4WD vehicle allegedly driven at two officers in Dandenong
item.description: Police say officers shot at a four-wheel-drive, which was allegedly driven at two officers in Dandenong on Thursday night.

item.title: Daylesford op shop may permanently close after donation causes bed bug infestation
item.description: The future of a Victorian op shop is in doubt after a worker opened a bag containing the stuff of nightmares, leading to the destruction of stock and hefty cleaning bills that may prove to be a deadly financial blow.

item.title: Search continues through the night for people trapped by landside at New Zealand's Mount Maunganui
item.description: Specialist officers have worked through the night with earthmoving equipment to try and find those trapped under the rubble at a popular tourist spot on New Zealand's North Island.

item.title: Specialist police teams flown in to hunt for man after three shot dead at Lake Cargelligo
item.description: Specialist police officers flown in by the Defence Force are searching for a man police have identified after three people were shot dead in a remote New South Wales town on Thursday.

item.title: Australia Day forecast to break Adelaide temperature record, 'catastrophic' fire danger warning for Yorke Peninsula
item.description: The South Australian Country Fire Service is urging people to reconsider travelling to the Yorke Peninsula over the long weekend and Adelaide is forecast to have its hottest Australia Day on record.

item.title: David Speirs not entitled to public campaign funding, electoral commission says
item.description: Former opposition leader David Speirs would "not fulfil the nomination requirements" if he applied to be a candidate at the upcoming state election, the state's electoral commission says, raising significant doubts about his chances of a political comeback.

item.title: Solid start to AI camera trial with rock fisher rescue at one of NSW's deadliest locations
item.description: Surf Life Saving NSW says the successful rescue of a rock fisher at Kiama Blowhole using two AI-enabled surveillance cameras proves the technology works.

item.title: triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025 — when it happens, how to listen and more
item.description: Australia's favourite music poll is back for another year — here's when it happens and how to listen.

item.title: Former childcare worker sentenced to community service after pleading guilty to assaulting five-year-old
item.description: A former Queensland childcare worker who dunked a child in a "muddy" puddle, causing him to hit a toy and injure his face, has been sentenced to 100 hours of community service.

item.title: Two dead after truck and car collide and burst into flames at Narrabri
item.description: Two people have died and a major highway remains closed after a crash in northern New South Wales overnight.

item.title: Wawrinka's post-match recovery beer and an 'elite coffee snob' — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Madison Keys praises Melbourne coffee, Stan Wawrinka says he deserves a beer and Nick Kyrgios back to racquet throwing ways. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Live: 'Yes I will': Sussan Ley declares her leadership can survive Coalition split
item.description: Sussan Ley has declared her leadership will survive despite speculation the Coalition split could further damage her hold on the party. Follow live.

item.title: Homeschool 'drop-off' groups are booming but some say they are unregulated
item.description: Education experts say homeschooling's exploding popularity has sparked a growing market of "drop-off" groups.

item.title: DNA found in an ancient Colombian skeleton may hold answers to origin of syphilis
item.description: A previously unknown strain of syphilis bacteria has been discovered in human remains in Colombia, dating back 5,500 years.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis lose first round Australian Open men's doubles clash
item.description: After playing like "shadows of our former selves", Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis are out of the Australian Open men's doubles and into an uncertain future.
